channel.title: Home on Columbia Psychology: Prospective Visit Days (2022)

item.title: Resources
item.description: Resources During Prospective Visit Days, we will use a few different platforms to facilitate your virtual visit. If you have any questions about how to use them, or if you experience any unforeseen technical difficulties, please don’t hesitate to let us know! Kumospace Kumospace is an immersive video chat platform that allows people to mingle within a virtual event space. During Prospective Visit Days, social events will take place at the event-specific Kumospace links found on the Schedule page.

item.title: Schedule
item.description: Schedule Please note that the schedule below is tentative and subject to change. Wednesday, February 2nd 6:00p onward Virtual Social Event Prospective and current graduate students Kumospace Thursday, February 3rd 10:00a - 10:30a Welcome Dr. Kevin Ochsner, Department Chair [Faculty Profile] Zoom 10:30a - 10:40a Break 10:40a - 11:20a Faculty Meeting 1 Zoom (see email) 11:25a - 12:05p Faculty Meeting 2 Zoom (see email) 12:05p - 1:00p Break (Lunch) 1:00p - 1:40p Faculty Meeting 3 Zoom (see email) 1:45p - 2:25p Faculty Meeting 4 Zoom (see email) 2:25p - 3:00p Break 3:00p - 3:30p Information Session

item.title: Virtual Tour
item.description: Virtual Tour Campus and Morningside Heights Although Columbia University was established in 1754, it moved throughout New York City several times before settling in 1897 in its current location in Morningside Heights, which is nestled between the Upper West Side and Harlem in the borough of Manhattan. Schermerhorn Hall, the location of the psychology department, is one of the original buildings in this current location. To learn more about our department and the university, check out the following virtual tour!
